page.title: 02DAIRY FARMING_THE FLOSHES
page.content: Floshes Farm has 113 acres of land.The farm has been in Mrs.Nelson's family for 46 years.They have about 250 Friesian cows. They keep 75 for milking,60 for fattening,35 for replacements and the remainder are stirks.They also grow barley which they use for cattle food.Four people work on the farm,Mr. Nelson,his 2 sons and 1 girl student. The farmer works long hours.In winter he starts work at 6-15a.m. and finishes at about 6-00 p.m. but in the summer he sometimes does not finish until 10-00 p.m. At calving time he can often be up all night. Mr.Nelson would like more land because he has to bid for extra grazing land at an auction. He says that dairy farming is more productive than it used to be.He has all the machinery he needs except a combine harvester.
